Comment: Fun and interesting clash that is not too hard but also requires a bit of thought.

âœ… Approved the contribution.
Comment: Good for the clash due to the directly behind.

âœ… Approved the contribution.
Comment: Nice clash, solvable in 5 minutes in Reverse mode.

At first it seems harder than it is, until you realise behind means "directly behind". The statement makes this clear in Fastest/Shortest mode, but the tests make it clear in Reverse too.

Goal
* Please format "Person" and "is behind Person" as {{constants}}.

Input
* Please format "Person" and "is behind Person" as {{constants}}.

Stub generator
* The easiest way is to have only the number of statements ([[M]]) as the input, but not the number of people ([[N]]). Then in Goal section you'll explain that there are [[M]] + 1 people.

An ugly way is to have [[N]] as input meaning both the number of people *and* the number of statements, but either the first statement or the last statement is empty.

I myself prefer the first way, but it's up to you.

Difficulty level
* I don't think it's difficult. A straightforward way is check who is at the front of the line is to check which person is never described as standing behind somebody, and it shouldn't be too difficult to figure that out or to write the code to do just that. One can use a set, as you mentioned in your code, or a dictionary, or even just a list.

Thanks.

Thanks for the feedback. I'll give the number of statements as input instead.
I didn't think it was too difficult either, just had to check :)
Solvable in 2 minutes in Reverse mode... But that's just for the pro coders ðŸ˜‹ðŸ˜…
